Simulate repeated water impacts to drive the 'turning off' state machine until the fire fully extinguishes. Target MonoBehaviour is Fire (m_Script guid: 1729fd01c90a64d5b8037e1eef0d000d, fileID: 11500000) with scene-serialized config: debug=0, isOn=0, timeToOnMin=40, timeToOnMax=60, maxHitInterval=2, totalHitTime=5, onNeighborsThreshold=2, minNeighborDownDistance=3, mainEffectGo->ParticleSystem fileID 1849464941111748095. During this trigger window, external water system should invoke IWaterInteractable.WaterHit(Vector3 normal) on this component at intervals < maxHitInterval (e.g., every 1s) so currentHitTime reaches >= totalHitTime and UpdateFireState(true) is invoked to Stop() particle systems and FireController.Instance.FireChanged(-1) is called. Note: No UnityEvent m_Calls are present in scene data; calls must be performed by the water system.

Edge case: Verify that if water hits are not continuous, the 'turning off' process cancels. Call WaterHit(Vector3) once, then do NOT call it again for >= maxHitInterval (2s). Expected: isTurningOff resets (false), currentHitTime resets to 0. Ensures the maxHitInterval branch in Update() is covered.

Ignition via neighbor threshold: Ensure onNeighbors >= onNeighborsThreshold (2) and at least one neighbor is positioned lower by > minNeighborDownDistance (3) to exercise downMultiplier path. Prereqs: Fire.FindNeighbors(Fire[] allFires, int fireId) must have been called (by a scene controller) so 'neighbors' and 'onNeighbors' are populated. Keep neighbors 'on' so CheckNeighborState() sets shouldTurnOn=true. Wait until timeToOn elapses (randomized between timeToOnMin [40] and timeToOnMax [60], note prefab modification may set debug=1 and maxNeighborDistance=3.5). Expected: Fire turns on (isOn=true), UpdateFireState(true) plays ParticleSystem and notifies neighbors; FireController.Instance.FireChanged(1) invoked.

Neighbor-driven ignition propagation. MonoBehaviour_0 on this GameObject maps exactly to Fire.cs (m_Script guid=1729fd01c90a64d5b8037e1eef0d000d, fileID=11500000). Serialized config: isOn=false, timeToOnMin=40, timeToOnMax=60 (Awake sets timeToOn ∈ [40,60]), onNeighborsThreshold=2, maxNeighborDistance=4, minNeighborDownDistance=3, downMultiplier=2, BoxCollider enabled. Preconditions to ignite: at least two nearby Fire neighbors (within 4 units) report NotifyNeighborState(true) so onNeighbors≥2; one neighbor positioned >=3 units below to set hasDownNeighbor=true. Expected behavior: shouldTurnOn becomes true, timeToOnDelta accumulates (faster if hasDownNeighbor due to downMultiplier). When timeToOnDelta ≥ timeToOn, isOn toggles true, UpdateFireState(true) is called internally: mainEffectGo's ParticleSystem.Play(), neighbors notified, FireController.Instance.FireChanged(1). Note: No parameterless public methods are exposed for manual calls; this relies on neighbor events and Update loop.

Water suppression turn-off path. Same MonoBehaviour (Fire.cs) as above. Preconditions: fire is currently on (isOn=true) from previous test or via setup. Repeated water impacts must invoke Fire.WaterHit(Vector3) such that currentHitInterval remains < maxHitInterval=2 for the entire duration, and cumulative currentHitTime ≥ totalHitTime=5. Expected behavior: On first hit, isTurningOff=true and currentHitInterval resets; with subsequent hits before 2s gap, currentHitTime accumulates; once currentHitTime≥5, fire turns off: isOn=false, shouldTurnOn=false, timers reset, UpdateFireState(true) runs internally causing ParticleSystem.Stop(), neighbors notified, FireController.Instance.FireChanged(-1). Note: WaterHit(Vector3) is a public method but requires a parameter; there are no public parameterless methods to invoke via Trigger. This test relies on actual collision/interaction from a water projectile/system to call WaterHit automatically.
